Microbial Eukaryote Evolution and Ecology

Our research group has broad interests in microbial eukaryotes. Often called protists, they are unicellular organisms with complex cells that are invisible to the naked eye but present in various ecosystems on this planet.

We are currently focusing on three research areas: 1. evolutionary history of marine microalgae (which account for half of CO2 fixation worldwide); 2. genome regulation and evolution of giant viruses infecting diverse microbial eukaryotes; and 3. dissecting interactions between microbial eukaryotes using single-cell omics approaches.

Our lab belongs to the Institute of Plant and Microbial Biology, which is part of Academia Sinica, both the national academy and foremost research institution of Taiwan. The principal investigator is Chuan Ku (顧銓).
